result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Kwaame It was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Prisoner Throw/Expel Bodily Substances, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.43(2m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $101.88 to BP;  and $522.00 to Village of Fox Point Police Department. Bail to apply. (assessments entered on 14CF2788)

DNA surcharge, costs and disbursements.
To be taken by DOC from prison funds not to exceed 25%.  Balance to be paid while on Extended Supervision, by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay amounts in full would result in a civil judgment entered against defendant.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain employment.  Be given job and vocational training.
Undergo a mental health evaluation. Follow thru with any treatment recommended.

No contact with Krystaly R., BP Gas statin at 5125 W. Brown Deer Road Brown Deer, WI.
No controlled substances or alcohol.
AODA assessment, treatment if needed.  Urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Body armor and firearms warning given. Voting admonishment given. Dna notification given.

Defendant Anthony Kwaame It in court, in custody MSDF.  Alex Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Zoom appearances.  ALJ informs the court that they believe the defendant is not competent to proceed with revocation proceedings. Pursuant to Sec. 971.14(2) Wis. Stats., Court ordered defendant to be examined by the Wisconsin Forensic Unit.   Defendant requested Dr Collins perform exam however, was advised Drs are appointed on a rotation.  Court ordered case adjourned for doctor report return via Zoom.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for October 15, 2020 at 08:30 am.h

per order dated November 20, 2018, Appeal No. 2018AP001911 CR, IT IS ORDERED that the court grants permission to proceed without payment of the filing fee. Indigency may be reevaluated if a request is received for waiver of other fees based on indigency.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Anthony Kwaame It not in court, in custody.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in lengthy trial. Case is adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  File retained in court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Kwaame It in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Body armor and Firearms warnings given.  Voting admonishment given.  DNA notification given.
Court ordered case out of suspended status.
Arguments on bail heard.  Court set bail at $1,000.00 cash with TOT to Justice Point.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this remains assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Defense counsel requested a plea date.  Court ordered case continued before Branch 20.

Defendant Anthony Kwaame It in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Anthony Kwaame It in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Doctor's report received by all parties.  Court has colloquy with defendant who believes he is competent to proceed.  Neither party challenges findings in report.  Court ordered proceedings reinstated.
Received and filed.

Defendant Anthony Kwaame It in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Anthony Kwaame It in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.   
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  
Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  
Order for Examination, signed and filed.   
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  
Doctor's Report Return scheduled for May 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
